{"step_by_step_thinking": "The patient delivered a baby with normal expulsion of an intact placenta, but started bleeding vaginally 30 minutes later. On examination, she was hypotensive and had a boggy mass palpated abdominally. USG showed retained placental tissues. This suggests that the placenta did not fully separate from the uterine wall after delivery, which is a characteristic of placenta accreta. This condition is characterized by abnormal implantation of the placenta, resulting in invasion of the myometrium.", "answer_choice": "C"}
